articles.title: Developped Tools
articles.contents:
mFD R Package and associated tutorials
During my PhD, I have developped the mFD R package which computes and plots functional diversity indices.

It is currently available on CRAN and Github for the development version.
Its website goes with a set of tutorials to help to go through the functional analysis process.
Website on the basics of Code Reproductibility in R
During on a project made during a teaching unit done by the FRB-CESAB in Montpellier (December 2021), two other PhD students and I have build a website on the basics of Code Reproductibility. Lena Klay, Erwan Harscouet and I hope that this PokeReproductibility website can help newcomers in the Reproductibility to understand the key concepts!

articles.title: Camille Magneville
articles.description: PhD Student . Functional Diversity . Marine Fishes
articles.contents:
Figure 1: Coral Reefs from Mayotte (Indian Ocean)



Hi!



I am a PhD student at the MARBEC lab, University of Montpellier in France. I am supervised by Sébastien Villéger and Thomas Claverie.
I am currently working on marine fish functional diversity and its temporal variation at the within day and between-day scales, using long-duration underwater remote cameras.
Details: I study the contribution of fish species to ecosystem processes, what we call their functional role. Instead of looking at species richness (number of species in a given location), I am looking at species characteristics (such as their diet, their size …) shaping their role in the environment and also precise processes such as the herbivory activity which shape ecosystem functioning. I am more precisely interested in the temporal variation of this functional diversity as for mobile species, such as fishes, their impact at a given location varies across time (because they move). I apply this framework to study the impact of tropicalisation on functional diversity and the effect of Marine Protected Areas on diversity accumulation through time.
During my PhD, I also had the opportunity to realise teaching at the University of Montpellier in Biostatistics, Functional Ecology and R programmation.
“Functional diversity is of ecological importance because it, by definition, is the component of diversity that influences ecosystem dynamics, stability, productivity, nutrient balance, and other aspects of ecosystem functioning.” Tilman, 2001
References
Tilman, D (2001) Functional Diversity.. S. A. Levin (Ed.), Encyclopedia of Biodiversity, Second Edition, 587-596.

articles.contents:
Links
Google Scholar | ORCID
2022
Magneville et al. (2022). Long-duration remote underwater videos reveal that grazing by fishes is highly variable through time and dominated by non-indigenous species.

Magneville, C., Ratz, T., Richardson, J., & Smiseth, P. T. (2018) No evidence of sibling cooperation in the absence of parental care in Nicrophorus vespilloides Evolution, 72(12), 2803–2809.

articles.title: Scientific Events
articles.contents:
Conference talks
2022
International Symposium on Coral Reefs (ICRS): A new framework based on synchronised cameras to measure fish abundance 
2021
International Symposium on Coral Reefs (ICRS): Tropical exotic fish are key herbivores in the Mediterranean sea 
R Rencontres 2021: Presentation of the mFD package - Recording of the talk here
Co-organised workshops
2022
I had the opportunity to co-organise a Workshop on Functional Rarity and Diversity in Ecology led by the FRB-CESAB and the FREE Research Group. During this workshop, we did a practical on the use of the mFD and the funrar R packages. Co-organisation with: Matthias Grenié and Sébastien Villéger
Scientific popularization
2022
I participated to the “Ma Thèse en 180 secondes” (Three Minuts Thesis) competition: the goal is to resume the thesis subject in 3 minutes for a non-scientific audience. My colleagues and I had the opportunity to speak in front of about 450 persons, it was an incredible experience! My talk in french here.
